instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing SSD EN
threads.message:
Hello!,
Got this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which had damaged SSD connector and few knocked off caps around it. Replaced SSD connector, turned on and off few times to test it and it was booting all fine, so decided to test fully with connected trackpad keyboard and speakers, after putting board back to housing it was coming on with question mark again.. And on top of that when i tried to boot to mac os x pendrive smoked (but not sure if the problem is new USB C to USB Adapter).
<SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_L</SIGNAL> Missing
<RESISTOR>R8640</RESISTOR> - 68K instead of 100K
<RESISTOR>R8645</RESISTOR> - 20K instead of 100K
<RESISTOR>R8620</RESISTOR> - 94K instead of 470K
All caps connecting with <CHIP>U8640</CHIP> looks good.

Any ideas where to have a look? :rolleyes:. As always appreciate any help!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing SSD EN
threads.message:
If smoke, should keft some sign; if was on the board.
Does the board still work now?
Did you try again to boot through USB?

High value resistors will show lower value measured onboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing SSD EN
threads.message: Board still works/boots to usb only not ssd - question mark.  Flash drive burned down. Still on this board I think values of resistors are too low as on working board as checked they go up to 100k and that one <RESISTOR>R8620</RESISTOR> over 400K, any ideas why on this one  values are so low?, what could I check, please?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing SSD EN
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R8620</RESISTOR> appears to be not mounted in my schematic; your board could be different revision.
However, big differences comparing with good board, can point to damage on SSD area.
Change <CHIP>U8640</CHIP>.

BTW, did you compare diode mode readings between boards w/ and w/o SSD inserted?
Also switch the SSDs between boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing SSD EN
threads.message: Replaced <CHIP>U8640</CHIP>, values on resistors way better now, found out that when usb flash drive burned down, ssd got damaged as well, tried to boot only to usb without ssd and board burned another one usb flash drive. SSD issue looks like resolved, but can't understand why is it burning all usb accesories?, Nothing happens to charging cable though  :rolleyes: .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing SSD EN
threads.message:
What kind of USB-C hub used?
Did you try another?
USB flash drive got burnt when charger was connected too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing SSD EN
threads.message: Used this one [URL]https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B015Z7XE0A/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o03_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1[/URL]. But usb c adapter works still fine, board kills whatever is connected to it and has IC's (maybe instead of 5V it gives all around 20V?). Yes, I tried another one usb c adapter and different flash drive, same results (another one burned flash drive). Looks like It also kills ssd's connected to board. Used only charger to power on machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing SSD EN
threads.message: Check if your input MOSFETs are not shorted IN-OUT (<TRANSISTOR>Q3100</TRANSISTOR>/200).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing SSD EN
threads.message:
Thank you!, problem was in mosfets, replaced, stopped killing pen drives finally, boots to external devices, but unfortunately still can't boot to ssd.. Checked Compared <CHIP>U8640</CHIP> pins to good board so only difference i found is between pin6 <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_CONN_L</SIGNAL> 108K (bad board) = 2.300K (good board).
Also in every board i could find <RESISTOR>R8645</RESISTOR> resistance was 90-100K on mine one only 20.70K. On diode mode <CHIP>U8640</CHIP>  pin6 = 0.475 (bad one)     0.668    (good one). Replaced already <RESISTOR>R8620</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C8671</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C8670</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C8673</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C8674</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R8641</RESISTOR>. Could it be that ssd slot itself damaged again when mofsets were failing as it killed one ssd already?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing SSD EN
threads.message:
Input MOSFETs are not related with SSD in anyway.
That higher ohm value on <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_CONN_L</SIGNAL> can be sign of bad solder at <CHIP>U8640</CHIP>.
Strange to get lower value in diode mode.
Change <CHIP>U8640</CHIP> again.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R8640</RESISTOR>/45 have correct values, measured out of board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Missing SSD EN
threads.message: All problems sorted, just need to fit new keyboard and will be as good as new. Finally found out that some of this model boards does not suppose to have <CHIP>U8640</CHIP>, <RESISTOR>R8640</RESISTOR>,  <RESISTOR>R8645</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R8637</RESISTOR> mounted, so removed these and finally machine boots to SSD!, Thank you  2informaticos for your guidance and time, really appreciate it!
